data.author: Víctor Mayoral Vilches
data.message:
Enrich ROS_VITIS to be enabled only by VITIS hardware platforms

The ROS_VITIS_TARGET is set only/if the target hardware is a Vitis
platform. This is done by the corresponding toolchain/mixin
extensions. See acceleration_firmware_kv260 for an example

Signed-off-by: Víctor Mayoral Vilches <v.mayoralv@gmail.com>

data.author: Víctor Mayoral Vilches
data.message:
Add ROS_VITIS and ROS_XRT variables

These two new CMake variables allow further granularity
in the target definitions within the CMakeLists.txt files.

Mainly, ROS 2 packages can now decide to build binaries or
libraries depending on whether Vitis or XRT are enabled.

Signed-off-by: Víctor Mayoral Vilches <v.mayoralv@gmail.com>

data.author: Víctor Mayoral Vilches
data.message:
Add vitis_link_kernel CMake macros

These new seet allows to link acceleration kernels
(.xo files) into a single xclbin file, simplifying
the process to craft Accelerated Applications (AA)
to match the Vitis flows.

Signed-off-by: Víctor Mayoral Vilches <v.mayoralv@gmail.com>

Release 0.8.0

Signed-off-by: Víctor Mayoral Vilches <v.mayoralv@gmail.com>

data.author: Víctor Mayoral Vilches
data.message:
Add DTSI support to vitis_acceleration_kernel, refactor

These changes add support for providing a DTSI file within
the kernel definition CMake macro which triggers a dtc build
generating the corresponding partial device tree overlay.

This logic is helpful while creating accelerated applications
that require modifications to the general device tree.

Minor refactoring and defaults also added.

Signed-off-by: Víctor Mayoral Vilches <v.mayoralv@gmail.com>

data.author: Víctor Mayoral Vilches
data.message:
Refactor vitis_acceleration_kernel, add clock and link capabilities

vitis_acceleration_kernel CMake macro has been refactored, code
has been extended to include separated build, link and package
capabilities (now specified from the macro invocations directly
).

A new clock argument has been added which allows to also set the
target clock (in Hz) while building the Xilinx Object (.xo) file.
This capability is redundant to specifying the clock in the .cfg
files for the build process, which can be done as follows:

[hls]
clock=300000000:vadd_accelerated

Signed-off-by: Víctor Mayoral Vilches <v.mayoralv@gmail.com>

data.author: Víctor Mayoral Vilches
data.message:
Support multiple include directories with either relative or absolute paths

This patch extends the CMake macros from supporting HLS operations
to:

a) support various directories
b) support the digestion of either relative or absolute paths.

If absolute, no addition is made to it. If relative, the
'/' value is prepended.

Signed-off-by: Víctor Mayoral Vilches <v.mayoralv@gmail.com>

data.author: Víctor Mayoral Vilches
data.message:
Re-initialize VITIS_HLS_SRC_VALUE to allow for various HLS calls

Previously, it was only possible to call once the HLS macros per
CMakeLists.txt file. If more, VITIS_HLS_SRC_VALUE variable was
using values from previous runs, which messed up results.

This patch initializes VITIS_HLS_SRC_VALUE every time the macro
is called mitigating previous issues and allowing for multiple
uses.

Signed-off-by: Víctor Mayoral Vilches <v.mayoralv@gmail.com>

data.author: Víctor Mayoral Vilches
data.message:
Add CMake macro to generate Tcl scripts

vitis_hls_generate_tcl macro will command CMake to generate
the corresponding Tcl script according to the parameters
provided.

The macro can be used directly in the CMakeList.txt file of
each corresponding ROS 2 package to simplify the HLS
integration.

Further automation might be implemented by extending colcon
CLI tooling.

Signed-off-by: Víctor Mayoral Vilches <v.mayoralv@gmail.com>

data.author: Víctor Mayoral Vilches
data.message:
Initial commit

- Add first iteration on macros, support both Xilinx tools
as well as custom ROS packages.
- Macros work for all build targets
- Variables shield env. variables abstracting them to have
a coherent environment for Vitis v++.

Signed-off-by: Víctor Mayoral Vilches <v.mayoralv@gmail.com>
